name: Duke Mai-Fleur's Hunting Lodge
tagline: Rugged knolls dense with holly. Blasts of hunting horns echo on the wind.

procedural.encounter_notes: Encounters are 1-in-6 likely (2-in-6 likely at night) to be with a Wild Hunt mustering in the woods around the lodge
procedural.foraging_results: Successful foraging yields 1d4 portions of Gillywort (DPB), in addition to the normal results

description: Rugged knolls dense with holly. Blasts of hunting horns echo on the wind.

points_of_interest.name: The Unicorn Gate
points_of_interest.description: A pair of great oak trees stands atop a tall hill. Into the living trunk of each tree is carved the likeness of a rearing unicorn. They face one another.
points_of_interest.entering: Blowing a horn causes a brisk wind to pick up and a shimmering blue mist to fill the space between the two trees.
points_of_interest.interior: Entering the mist whisks one away to the fairy road Duke Mai-Fleur's Road (see Fairy Roads, p26).

points_of_interest.name: Duke Mai-Fleur's Hunting Lodge
points_of_interest.description: A two-storey wooden lodge, camouflaged by the trailing moss that blankets it. Even the windows are obscured.
points_of_interest.entering: Stepping onto the front porch causes the moss to peel back, revealing a polished black door, carved with scenes of unicorn hunting and the holly-wreath sigil of Duke Mai-Fleur. The door is sealed with a Glyph of Locking (Level 14 caster).
points_of_interest.interior: Passages, drinking halls, and three bed chambers, spartanly furnished but replete with hunting trophies, including three great black bears and two majestic unicorns. Blue candles in wall sconces magically kindle.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Any who enter without permission are attacked by animated stuffed animals: 3 bears (DMB) and 2 blessed unicorns (DMB). As magical constructs, the creatures have Morale 12 and are immune to poison and mind-affecting magic (e.g. Ingratiate, Vapours of Dream).
special_features: Mai-Fleur's Drinking Horn: At the centre of a drinking hall table is a 2′-long horn of fairy silver, studded with pale blue ice jewels. Once a day, water poured into the horn is transmuted into exquisite, sparkling wine. Worth 5,000gp.

roll_tables.name: The Wild Hunt
roll_tables.description: A raucous train of fairies gleefully charging through the forest after prey

entries.description: 3-in-6 chance that the hunt is led by Duke Mai-Fleur himself, otherwise by an elf knight (DMB) loyal to the Duke.
4d6 fairy hounds (stats as wolves), 2d10 elf wanderers (DMB) on foot, 2d10 elf wanderers (DMB) mounted on fairy horses (DMB), 1d6 woodgrues (DMB—horn-blowers), 1d6 sylvan centaurs (DMB).
The fairies do not discriminate between their intended quarry and PCs who get in their way.

npcs.name: Duke Mai-Fleur
npcs.title: Duke
npcs.description: A lithesome half-elf / half-human lord with ashen complexion and flowing raven locks. The light of a blazing sunset shines in his eyes. Dresses as a hunter, crowned with holly and ivy. Mai-Fleur is renowned as the most accomplished hunter in all Dolmenwood.
demeanor: Dreadful anger and heartening laughter are ever imminent
desires: To locate game worthy of a fairy lord (e.g. the Stag Lord in hex 1305, the Bicorne in hex 0510)
possessions: Silver Sword (Fairy Longsword of fairy silver)
npcs.stat_reference: Medium Fairy—Genius—Neutral, Level 14 AC 19 HP 75 Saves D4 R5 H6 B7 S8

items.name: Mai-Fleur's Drinking Horn
items.description: A 2′-long horn of fairy silver, studded with pale blue ice jewels. Once a day, water poured into the horn is transmuted into exquisite, sparkling wine.

items.name: Magical Hunting Horn
items.description: A magical hunting horn which, if blown, summons a Wild Hunt to their command. This may be used once only and works like the mighty fairy rune Summon Wild Hunt—DPB.

dm_notes: See p30 for more details on the duke and his domain.
